newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Mondi workers embark on wage strike - union.
newsitem.headline: Mondi workers embark on wage strike - union.

text.p: Workers at the paper division of Mondi, a subsidiary of Anglo American Industrial Corp Ltd, went on strike on Wednesday night after wage negotiations broke down, a union official said on Thursday.
Mhlaba Mkhize, a spokesman for the Paper, Printing, Wood and Allied Workers' Union, told Reuters that union members had downed tools over management's refusal to budge from their nine percent offer.
"We began negotiations asking for a 14.75 percent increase across the board but dropped that to 11 percent to meet management halfway, but they stood firm at nine percent," he said.
"Negotiations have stopped and there have been no more contacts between (the union) and management."
He said members of the union, representing about 1,000 workers at Mondi's Paper division and 15,000 in KwaZulu-Natal province, would not return to work until their demands were met.
Mkhize said annual wage negotiations at Mondi's Kraft division were also stalling and there was a possibility that some 700 workers there could also be called out on strike.
Mondi management could not be reached for comment.
